data.title: Defer the callback to the next tick.
data.body:
This gives `GitRepository` the chance to clear its path cache before the callback is invoked. Otherwise reads from the cached status state within the callback would be wrong.

Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11396.

data.title: Tree view doesn't update git status for files not in the root
data.body:
I suspect this was introduced in https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11280, which is why I'm filing it here and not on `tree-view`.
1. Edit a file in a subdir of the project (e.g., `some/cool/file.txt`).
2. Commit the file from the command line.
3. Switch back to Atom.

Expected: The file's not shown as modified anymore.
Actual: The file's still marked as modified.

data.title: Atom crashes on opening a HTML file
data.body:
### Description

Atom crashes, when I open an HTML file (named msw.html)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Download file https://gist.github.com/dandaka/35c535fde59a37f2ee1fab8109a2e05f
2. Name it msw.html
3. Open in Atom

**Expected behavior:**

Normal opening of a file

**Actual behavior:** 

Crash

Also pasting same content in Atom also crashes it.
### Versions

Atom 1.6.2
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.7.2
OSX 10.11.4

Crash log https://gist.github.com/dandaka/51d307c732651dfc06494f01f6cb5b5d
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: [Yes]
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: Don't know
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: [Yes]
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Don't know

Win 10 x64

data.title: Duplicate tabs
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

This is very likely a very low priority issue caused by a race condition in the deduper (@lee-dohm  theory) but it is possible (if you are fast enough) to open the same tab multiple times (I managed twice at least).
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open tab from tree view by clicking on it.
2. Immediately after step 1 press enter.
3. Observe you have 2 tabs of the same file open, in the case where pending pane items option is true you have the one pending tab and one confirmed tab, without pending pane items option you have 2 confirmed tabs.

For me this was easier at my work computer and with the first tab that i open in that atom window, as the first tab takes several seconds to load you have a bigger window to execute the 2nd step.
At home I can reproduce it but I have to try for a long time.

**Expected behavior:** Atom to switch to already open tab at all times.

**Actual behavior:** Atom opens multiple (at least 2 confirmed) tabs of the same file.
### Versions

1.6.X
Windows 7.

data.title: Tab guides are not aligned
data.body:
### Description

![Failed Identation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1977082/14328659/477a704c-fbfd-11e5-8228-d572aad897b6.png)
Whenever there is an empty line between my indented code, the tab guides are not aligned. I have my tabs indented as for four spaces, but the tab guides in the empty lines show three spaces. I do not see where in the settings this can be removed, since it is visually unappealing and distracting.

This problem is reproducible, both in and out of safe mode. This is a bug I have noticed since I have been using this program. I have only used v1.6.2. 
### Steps to Reproduce

![Animated Failed Identation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1977082/14328607/0c01338e-fbfd-11e5-9682-869f49134b49.gif)
1. Open the terminal
2. Run `atom --safe`
3. Press the `Enter` button five times to create five empty lines
4. Go to line 2
5. Press the `Tab` button twice to indent the code by two levels
6. Go to line 4
7. Press the `Tab` button twice to indent the code by two levels

**Expected behavior:** I expect that the tab guides are all aligned.

**Actual behavior:** The tab guides show different spacing depending if there is code or not. If there is code, it will indent four spaces per tab, if not, it will indent as if three spaces per tab.
### Versions

Atom.io 1.6.2
Ubunto 15.10

data.title: Cannot install packages (ETIMEDOUT) tried various fixes and keep getting "atom command not found" in CL. Not in path either.
data.body:
Hello, 

preface: I'm horribly new to this whole world of command lines, prompts and consoles... I've read other threads and some things just flew right over my head. I followed along and tried as much as I could but to no avail. 
[thread 1: Issue #4902 ](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4902)
[thread 2: Issue #11164 ](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11164)
### Description

cannot install packages nor themes. I try and it continuously times out and when I try various things (as far as I understand them) in the terminal, I get bupkis. 

I installed atom today. 
- version: 1.6.2
- OS: Win7 64bit
- terminals: Cygwin, Git Bash

**Expected behavior:** 

I expect packages to be installed, themes to be installed, and for my terminal to recognize that atom is a thing. 

**Actual behavior:** 

I tried installing both packages as well as a theme or two. Keep getting this error. 

``` console
Installing “atom-monokai@0.10.1” failed.Hide output…
Unable to download https://www.atom.io/api/packages/atom-monokai/versions/0.10.1/tarball: connect ETIMEDOUT
```

output from console

``` console
Installing theme atom-monokai failed Error: Installing “atom-monokai@0.10.1” failed.
    at C:\Users\Trading\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\node_modules\settings-view\lib\package-manager.js:457:21
    at exit (C:\Users\Trading\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\node_modules\settings-view\lib\package-manager.js:73:16)
    at triggerExitCallback (C:\Users\Trading\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\buffered-process.js:213:47)
    at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (C:\Users\Trading\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\buffered-process.js:235:18)
    at emitTwo (events.js:87:13)
    at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:172:7)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:200:12) Unable to download https://www.atom.io/api/packages/atom-monokai/versions/0.10.1/tarball: connect ETIMEDOUT
```

upon reading those other threads I tried several things including 
- using apm directly
- checking the version
- just opening atom 
- which atom

Here are the results

``` console
$ apm install atom-monokai
bash: apm: command not found

$ atom --version
bash: atom: command not found

$ atom.cmd --version
bash: atom.cmd: command not found

$ which atom.exe
which: no atom.exe in etc...etc...
```
### Versions

_"You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. "_

No... I in fact cannot do such miraculous things. 
### Conclusion

HAAALP. 

My apologies in advance for being a problem child that doesn't know all about environment variables and bash and shells to the point y'all do. It seems I'm gonna need me some hand holding.

data.title: New files opening within same tab
data.body:
- [No - but the problem is intermittent, I cannot consistently reproduce the bug, and therefore I cannot determine if it wouldn't happen in safe mode as I have to work and can't spend too much time testing ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [ yes] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [yes ] Did you check the [debugging guide](flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [yes ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [I hope so] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [yes - no results ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

To open a file I click on it on the left hand tree view and a tab opens with the file (ex. test.js).
Then I select another file in the tree (new.js) on the left and click on it.
Sometimes the new.js opens and test.js closes (giving the appearance that new.js is opening in test.js), and sometimes new.js would open in a separate tab.
Eventually clicking multiple times on multiple files will have them open separately.
I tried disabling all of my community packages - but that did not solve the problem. 
I then spent a good amount of time disabling core packages, but got inconsistent results. This bug would happen with certain packages on or off, and I was not able to identify a particular package that was causing the bug.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a file
2. open a separate file

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
I expect a separate tab to open for the new file without closing the old one
**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
The old tab is closed and therefore I can't have more than 1 file open at a time
### Versions

1.6.2
You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: Locked File While Open in Atom
data.body:
Description:

While editing a script file in Atom (.sh, .py, .php) that resides on a Raspberry Pi
from OSX over appletalk execution is blocked on the Pi.  Typical example of the 
activity follows.
1. Via Atom open the targeted script file by selecting it in the project Folder.
2. Make a change or just view the via
3. Switch to an ssh window (SecureCrt) run the file 
   "sudo ./sub.py"
4. Error message that is displayed 
   "sudo: unable to execute ./sub.py: Text file busy"

If I close the file in Atom it runs fine.  This happens with all scripts. The
same does not happen when I use TextWrangler.  I can have the file open in TextWrangler or any 
other editor without issue.

This error DOES NOT occur when I open a script on my MAC and run the script on my MAC.

Atom Version: 1.6.2
Mac Version: MacBook Pro Mid 2015
OSX Version: OS X El Capitan
Pi Version: B
Pi OS Version: Debian GNU/Linux 7.0 (wheezy)
Appletalk Version: Latest availble

Can be reproduced in safe mode.

data.title: CPU is being pegged by opening an empty file
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Posted tonight on Slack and spoke with @lee-dohm who directed me to create an issue here.  Lee asked me to try in safe mode and to try after closing the application and deleting `~/.atom/storage`

i've been seeing some strange behavior in atom (v1.6.2) the last 3 days on my mac(10.10.5) -- the editor starts overheating my laptop, cpu just gets overloaded.  Couldn't figure out what it was and today I long-clicked on the atom icon in my doc and I'm seeing this -- it shows that I have a bunch of buffers open, however, i do not have any buffers open at all.  Any idea how to reset this? I think this is causing the problem.

Here's a link to the image I posted on slack: https://files.slack.com/files-pri/T043R3J9D-F0YAGBL8Z/pasted_image_at_2016_04_05_08_44_pm.png

You'll see a list of files that it says I have open. I have no files open.  I believe there is a connection between references to those files and the CPU spike.  Any suggestion how to kill those pointers would be awesome.

I've also tried re-installing the application; this did not fix the issue.
### Steps to Reproduce

i have no steps to reproduce.  This is happening when I open the editor to any file, any project, or even an empty file.  Just leaving the editor open without doing anything will cause the cpu to spike and the editor will become unresponsive and a force quit is required.

data.title: Atom deletes the files from disk
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ N] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [Y ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [Y ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [Y ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

[Description of the bug or feature]
I am using atom in mac. It deletes all the opened files from disk. When I try to close the opened files, it asked me to save the file which i didn't change in the editor. And I saved it . Then it deleted all the other files which was not opened[active] in the editor from disk. Is there a way to recover the files. It is my one month project work. I desperately want those files.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. [First Step]
2. [Second Step]
3. [and so on...]

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
Should not delete files even in the worst case
**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
I am using atom in mac. It deletes all the opened files from disk. When I try to close the opened files, it asked me to save the file which i didn't change in the editor. And I saved it . Then it deleted all the other files which was not opened[active] in editor from disk. 
### Versions

1.6.0
You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: "Uncaught (in promise) GitRepositoryAsync.destroyed: Repository has been destroyed" on spec runs
data.body:
# When I run spec, spec passes, but it put error like blow.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/155205/14286799/4dbc8944-fb8b-11e5-998b-49cfc1c823e4.png)

AFAIR this error start from Atom v1.6.2.
This error is not by my code change.

When I re-run previous spec(which was not includes this error in logs of previous run) via Travis-CI, new result includes this `Repository has been destroyed` error.
This error is not my package specific, see [status-bar](https://travis-ci.org/atom/status-bar)

Minimum spec to reproduce error is below, spec passes but console.log put `Repository has been destroyed` error.

```
describe "git-repo-error", ->
  [editor] = []

  beforeEach ->
    waitsForPromise ->
      atom.workspace.open("sample").then (e) ->
        editor = e

  it "test", ->
    null
```

data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?

### Description

When open the following file and save it without any modifying, some unicode characters were changed.
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/skilliscode/is-thirteen/6ccd4d73758a7121108a32bcbca945699cffcf99/index.js
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the file.
2. Save the buffer.

**Expected behavior:** Should not change the file content.

**Actual behavior:** Lines 44, 83, 215 were changed.
### Versions

atom 1.6.2
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.6.4
OS X EI Capitan 10.11.3 (15D21)

data.title: Column count to start at 0 rather than 1? Option to change
data.body: When analyzing certain files, it would be easier for me to read the first column as column zero as to stay consistent with what I'm doing. I understand this isn't beneficial to everyone, but perhaps a toggle option for where to start counting the columns (column 0 or column 1)?

data.title: Tokenize visible buffer chunk immediately
data.body:
When opening a new file, there is currently a flash of unstyled content ("FOUC") between the point where the file is first rendered and when syntax highlights are rendered. This gap can be hundreds of milliseconds, and the flash can be jarring.

To resolve this, I propose paying some tokenizing costs up front so that the first rendering of the file is already highlighted. Tokenize the first chunk, then defer the rest.

This means implicitly adding 20ms or so to the initial render pass, but there is no longer a jarring style change.

Test Plan:

Open JS files of varying sizes. Verify that the initial render of the file is already highlighted, with no flash.

data.title: :racehorse: Avoid setting hidden input value on textInput
data.body:
Atom currently sets the `value` of the input on every `textInput` event, in an effort to appropriately handle changes made via the OSX diacritic menu (for accents, umlauts, etc).

The drawback of this is approach is that updating the value of the input will trigger layout and a subsequent layer tree update.

To resolve this, here is my proposal:
- Track a flag for `keypress` events. When the diacritic menu is used, there are two `textInput` events, with no `keypress` in between. Therefore, when no `keypress` has occurred just prior to a `textInput`, the editor model can select the previous character to be replaced by the new accented character.
- Track a flag for `compositionstart` events. When a user is in IME mode, the diacritic menu cannot be used, so the editor can skip the backward selection.

Test Plan:

Tested in a plaintext file.
- Type Latin characters, verify proper character insertion.
- Press and hold <kbd>a</kbd>. Diacritic menu appears. Select an option using the keyboard or mouse. Verify that the `a` is replaced by an accented `a`, with no extra characters.
- Type test strings in Katakana, 2-Set Korean, Telex (Vietnamese), Simplified Pinyin. Verify that characters are inserted correctly while composing, and after committing strings.

cc @ssorallen @nathansobo

data.title: Launching from Terminal with path argument doesn't restore previously open windows
data.body:
When launching from command line tool `atom` with a path argument while the app isn't open, any previously open window will not be restored.

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Type in Terminal: `atom project1/`
2. Type in Terminal: `atom project2/`
3. Quit Atom app 
4. Type in Terminal: `atom project3/`

**Expected behavior:**

The windows with `project1` and `project2` should be restored, just like when typing just `atom` without argument at step 4.

**Observed behavior:**

After step 4, only `project3` window is displayed in Atom, `project1` and `project2` are discarded.

**Atom version:** Atom 1.6.2
**OS and version:** OS X 10.11.4

**Installed packages:**


- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: Don't Know
